benchmark_details.name: HERM-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: HERM-Bench is a benchmark for evaluating the human-centric understanding capabilities of Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs), spanning 8 evaluation dimensions including basic perception and complex understanding. It provides a comprehensive assessment of existing MLLMs' abilities in human-centric scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the human-centric understanding capabilities of Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) and identify limitations in their current training data.

data.source: HERM-100K dataset constructed from diverse image sources with multi-level human-centric annotations.
data.annotation: Annotations generated using GPT-4V with diverse image sources.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on normal evaluation scores and IoU for grounding tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in evaluating human-centric understanding.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison of HERM-7B against various MLLMs on HERM-Bench shows it outperforms all others.
methodology.validation: Evaluations were conducted across multiple existing MLLMs to ensure comprehensive assessments.

harm: Inadequate representation of diverse human scenarios due to suboptimal training data.
